newsitem.title: POLAND: Gec-Alsthom to control Poland's Konstal.
newsitem.headline: Gec-Alsthom to control Poland's Konstal.

text.p: French consortium Gec-Alsthom signed a deal with 15 Polish National Investment Funds (NFIs) to buy a 60-percent stake in Polish rolling stock producer Konstal, an official from NFI No.10 said.

Piotr Wielowieyski told Reuters that NFI No. 10 sold its 33 percent stake in the company and the remaining 14 NFIs sold their 1.93-percent stakes each, but did not disclose the value of the transaction.
"We signed an agreement yesterday on selling the company, but we still need Polish interior ministry and anti-monopoly office permits to conclude the deal," he said.
The state treasury holds a 25 percent stake in the company and employees have 15 percent.
Wielowieyski said the agreement provided for Gec-Alsthom to invest in Konstal a certain amount of money, but declined to give any figures.
Konstal, based in Chorzow, south-western Poland, recorded a net loss of 5.1 million zlotys in the December 1, 1994 to December 31, 1995 period on 31.8-million-zloty sales.
